vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
ἀπάρχομαι,
make a beginning, especially in sacrifice; τρίχας ἀπάρχεσθαι begin the sacrifice with the hair, i.e. by cutting off the hair from the forehead and throwing it into the fire, κάπρου ἀπὸ τρίχας ἀρξάμενος[Refs 8th c.BC+]
__II later with genitive, cut off part of a thing, offer it, τοῦ ὠτὸς τοῦ κτήνεος[Refs 5th c.BC+]; τῶν κρεῶν καὶ σπλάγχνων offer part of them, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__II.2 offer the first-lings or first-fruits, πάντων of all sacrifices, [Refs]: absolutely, begin a sacrifice, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; ἀπηργμένοι, of eunuchs, having had their first-fruits offered, [Refs 4th c.BC+]
__II.3 metaphorically, take as the first-fruits, take as the choice or best, δικαστήν[Refs 5th c.BC+]: absolutely, offer first-fruits, [Refs 3rd c.BC+]
__III generally, offer, dedicate, χρυσᾶς (i.e. δραχμάς) [Refs 3rd c.BC+]
__IV later, ={ἄρχομαι}, begin, with genitive, πημάτων[Refs 3rd c.BC+]: with infinitive, variant in [Refs 2nd c.AD+]; practise, prelude on, ὀργάνων[Refs 4th c.AD+]
